item.title: That's no coincidence.
item.description: Everybody should start looking into every single thing that they can vote on no matter how minor. Yeah it's gone long enough. The moment Katharine Hepburn reveals the nature of fascism in the film Keeper of the Flame (1942). Her character, Christine Forrest, explains to journalist Steven O'Malley (Spencer Tracy) how her late husband, a seemingly revered national hero, was a secret fascist.

Here's the full 8.5 hours on YouTube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gGtlalhdL4c Transcript: https://judiciary.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/republicans-judiciary.house.gov/files/2025-12/Smith-Depo-Transcript_Redacted-w-Errata.pdf https://www.reddit.com/r/law/comments/1q0rv9f/jack_smith_there_is_no_historical_analogue_for/

item.title: Return of the Meme: 1571 (radiator bread)
item.description:
Let's get this bread.
Posting late today because I went birding.
45 species for the first day! Highlights included my first ever Mexican Duck, and a Merlin.
Anyway. Memes.
Hoping this year is kinder than last year.
Saw Mom yesterday. I think she's gonna pull through.
It really is. The only state that MIGHT be worse would be Hawaii.
Female lovebirds, especially. There is a reason fir the name of Princess Monster Truck....
Pippin tax! Today's message from Pippin: "Okay. Fuck." ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin

26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: @l33t8I did this cool drawing. Check out the ton of art they have in their posts and give them some love.
27 Man Tax: George Clooney
“They got money for wars, but can't feed the poor.” - 2Pac, Keep Ya Head Up I try to keep my posts "good vibe zones". So, instead of finding the one thing in here you don't like and commenting only on that, also comment about something you DID like. Balance the negativity. Love you long time. So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work, zero income. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've honestly been my lifeline. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me!

item.title: Reminder that things were pretty goddamned bad regarding gender in the 1980s also
item.description: Her name was Annie Lennox. And she was about to change everything. MTV was barely two years old. Its airwaves were dominated by glossy American rock bands and polished female stars who fit a very specific mold. Lennox looked like she had arrived from another planet entirely. Cold. Androgynous. Untouchable. That was entirely the point. When MTV first aired the "Love Is a Stranger" video, they pulled it mid-broadcast. Executives were convinced Lennox was actually a man in drag. They demanded that her record label send over her birth certificate to prove her gender. The controversy only made her more legendary. "Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)" became the song that launched Eurythmics into the stratosphere. The video, filmed in a boardroom with surreal imagery of cows wandering through fields, became an MTV staple. The song shot to number one in America, and suddenly Annie Lennox was a household name. But she wasn't trying to be famous. She was trying to be equal. In interviews, Lennox explained that her androgynous look wasn't about hiding her femininity. It was about standing beside her creative partner Dave Stewart as an equal, not as decoration. "I wanted to create something that was quite edgy and belonged to me," she later said. "It was saying that appearance is temporary, and I want to be as strong as a man." In an industry she described as a "frustrating boys' club," Lennox refused to play by its rules. She styled herself, bringing her own vintage suits to photo shoots. She turned down lucrative offers to be the face of major fashion houses because she didn't want to become "a mannequin for the corporate industry." She used her clothes as a tool. A statement. A form of resistance. The tabloids didn't understand her. Some mocked her appearance. Critics questioned whether audiences would accept a woman who looked like that. They were answered by twelve consecutive Emmy nominations for the show of millions who tuned in week after week to watch her perform. By multiple Grammy Awards. By being named "The Greatest White Soul Singer Alive" by VH1 and one of Rolling Stone's 100 Greatest Singers of All Time. By eight Brit Awards, including Best British Female Artist a record six times. But Lennox never limited herself to music. She became one of the most outspoken activists in the entertainment industry, dedicating herself to HIV/AIDS awareness and women's empowerment around the globe. She founded charities, spoke before parliaments, and used her platform to amplify voices that couldn't be heard. At the 1984 Grammy Awards, she walked on stage dressed as Elvis Presley, just to make sure everyone was paying attention. In 2022, at age 68, she and Dave Stewart were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. They performed "Sweet Dreams" once more, nearly forty years after they first shocked the world. Looking back, the BBC called her video for "Sweet Dreams" the moment that "broke the mould for female pop stars." But Annie Lennox didn't break the mold. She proved there never should have been one in the first place. One suit. One song. One woman who refused to be what the industry expected. And forty years later, she's still standing exactly as she always intended: as herself. #AnnieLennox #SweetDreams ~Professor Calcue

item.title: RFK Jr might be worse than Discharge
item.description: But that’s a rant for another time and post. https://www.mcsweeneys.net/articles/an-open-letter-to-robert-f-kennedy-jr-who-thinks-my-daughter-is-a-tragedy Dear Mr. RFK Jr., (The “dear” is tradition. Don’t mistake it for affection.) You said autistic children are a burden. That they ruin families. That they’ll never pay taxes or write poems. That they are, in essence, collateral damage. I’d like to introduce you to my daughter. She is five. She does not speak in sentences yet, but she knows how to answer a joke with a smirk. She organizes her markers by color, then chaos, then color again. She plays baseball without rules, which is probably the right way to play it. She hums when she’s thinking. She hums a lot. When another child’s upset—before the adults notice, before the child even cries—she takes their hand. She leans her forehead against theirs, gently, like she’s checking for a fever only she can feel. She doesn’t write poems. She is one. Sometimes she says a single word like it holds the whole sky. And no, she won’t be your campaign talking point. She won’t make your podium more sympathetic or your policies more tragic. She’s not yours to pity. She’s mine to marvel at. She is herself, entirely. That is not a flaw. It’s a form of resistance. You say children like her will never contribute. Here’s what I know: The world you move through was built by people who thought sideways. Who flapped their hands or didn’t look you in the eye. Who were told they were too much, or not enough, or broken in ways the world hadn’t bothered to understand. Neurodivergent minds imagined the future. And then invented it. If you’ve ever read Alice in Wonderland, or flown in a plane, or used a computer, or wore noise-canceling headphones on your way to one of your anti-vax fundraising dinners, you owe something to someone who thinks like her. These weren’t distractions or deficits. They were different ways of sensing, perceiving, creating meaning. Not all autistic people will redesign physics. They don’t need to. Their worth isn’t tied to invention, it’s intrinsic. Autism doesn’t erase potential. It reshapes it. Sometimes it’s quiet. Sometimes it’s nonlinear. Always, it’s human. The question isn’t whether people like my daughter have something to offer. It’s whether society is finally ready to stop measuring value with the wrong scale. Autism doesn’t destroy families. Ignorance does. Isolation does. Shame does. Especially when it comes packaged in a suit with a microphone and a claim to public good. Your version of the future has no room for her. Thankfully, she doesn’t need your permission to belong. She’s already here. Unapologetically, Anaïs (a mother, writer, and permanent campaigner for one exceptional, nonverbal, baseball-defiant poet) P.S. Noise-canceling headphones? Dr. Amar Bose. The computer or phone you’re reading this on? Alan Turing. The theory that reimagined time? Albert Einstein. The literary rabbit hole that still defines wonder? Lewis Carroll. The Sistine Chapel? Michelangelo. The spare, aching poetry still studied in every classroom? Emily Dickinson. The humane redesign of industrial farming systems? Temple Grandin. All neurodivergent. All part of the world you live in. Still here. Still building it.

item.description: Which is your favourite? HAPPY NEW YEAR! I wanted to make a little outfit video with lots of variants! Lots more on my patreon too! I took a little bit longer to finish this as I wanted to take my time and produce some cute outfits. I make a lot of Hexia's outfits black (because I really like black outfits as I'm sure you know ahaha), so next time I will do a more colourful and silly exciting outfit video! It will take a while, but stay tuned and maybe give some suggestions. Insta: miaormoa For extra outfits and a bit of spice: https://www.patreon.com/miaormoa This song is by Zooey Deschanel! Very pretty.

item.title: United States breakdown maps
item.description:
Showing the current borders then adjusting size down for population. Also shown in color density with more populous in dark red/brown (is that burnt umber?)
Here’s presidential voting (2016) that shows counties accounting for population but this doesn’t show purple counties only the result so red v blue
I feel like this one at least shows how states are rarely all that 100% red or blue—but some folks may point to a few states solid red and no state solid blue. For that, please see population and voting density. Any sufficiently populated state will have at least some measurable amount of both.
And since we’re looking at states, this is the 2022 Pornhub most searched term by state. Why 2022?
Because all these gray states mandated a means to verify age by ID so Pornhub…pulled out, and is no longer available in those states in 2024
And hells…since we’re talking breakdowns, here’s which states are the best after your mental breakdown. Gotta say based on population, the Dakotas (and other low pop states) might offer a lot of space to think and heal without having to see anyone else for days—but no Pornhub (just means creative internet use)
Upside down Mercury dog tax
